DataElement.preferredName: Permanent Tooth Enamel Caries Present Ind-4
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Continuing or enduring over time, without fundamental or marked change._The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.:A hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops and protects the dentin of the crown of the tooth. It is the hardest substance in the body and is almost entirely composed of calcium salts._The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._ A term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.

Property.preferredDefinition: A hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops and protects the dentin of the crown of the tooth. It is the hardest substance in the body and is almost entirely composed of calcium salts.:The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops and protects the dentin of the crown of the tooth. It is the hardest substance in the body and is almost entirely composed of calcium salts.
The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.
